intro: Latipes inermis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny yellow flowers, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
